reviews.review: Great game I suck but still enjoy this with my friends.

I love this game. It's gameplay stands high above other FPS's in my eyes. I love the way this game plays, the economy system, and a (lower than I wish) map pool. The only issue is the people that play this game. It can go really well in a game, with everybody just doing there best, giving constructive advice, or having a nice conversation. But very recently, almost every game I play is full of toxic players. From people getting my friends kicked by running into their spray, or people trying to scare my friends by digging deep into the internet to find a picture of their face and setting it as their pfp, or teammates calling my whole team and friends garbage every single round, or people smurfing and or hacking, and still talking trash. Obviously trash talk will always be there, but the amount that I've run across recently is scarily unhealthy for the games community. It's also getting annoying with players with an audience from streaming or such, can false report my friends into lower their trust factor. I love this game as a game, but the community makes it hard to have fun when I need it. I recommend this game, because it's a good game, but I give the warning that there are people out there trying to ruin your day.

simulador de escuchar a niños rusos de 12 años gritar

I do recommend this game as it is a very skill based game most times. 

I will say if you are planning on having a good CS:GO experience then figure out if you are planning on playing the game a lot.

If you really want to play the game and have a good time, I really recommend buying the $15 Prime Status Upgrade. 

I play a lot of community but getting a 5 man for matchmaking makes it a lot of fun. Although I would suggest waiting until you have enough time on the game to think you're ready for comp.

Don't play MM if you're at 100 hours. It's not worth it

TL;DR
Get game, play game, like game?, prime game >:)
Spent 834 hours on this game and it still sucks
